intro: Brachypodium chinense, commonly known as Chinese grass, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Brachypodium chinense is valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a model organism in plant genetics research.
